string.text: The character does not have enough money
The trader isn’t interested in items like this.
The item is too damaged to be traded.

Ionizing radiation poisoning
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Exposure to ionizing radiation poses an extremely high risk to the USS operative. For this reason every member of USS personnel is required to undergo training which enables them to adequately measure radiation levels. This skill becomes a key factor in their effectiveness within the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone. The basic unit in the scale of ionizing radiation is millisievert (%c[0,210,210,210]mSv%c[0,170,170,170]). Level of approximately %c[0,210,210,210]8000 mSv %c[0,170,170,170]is usually lethal without a chance of recovery. Radiation levels above the threshold of 1000 mSv (see below) may gradually negatively impact USS operative's performance. iIn case of exposure it is thus strongly advised to administer anti-radiation drugs of appropriate potency as soon as possible. Table 3.2 presents radiation levels with typical symptoms:
 
%c[0,102,255,0]250 – 1500 mSv: %c[0,140,140,140]Symptoms are unnoticeable. Long term consequences are negligible.
 
%c[0,255,255,0]1500 – 3000 mSv: %c[0,140,140,140]Noticeable moderate to strong sickness, light-headedness, skin stains. Long-term symptoms are mild. Full recovery is possible if treated promptly.
 
%c[0,255,122,0]3000 – 4500 mSv: %c[0,140,140,140]Very strong sickness, confusion and dizziness with premature death if not treated in relatively short time. Complete cease of hunger and thirst, taint, diarrhoea, shedding of skin and hair loss. High risk of permanent loss of reproduction ability. Restoration of bodily functions is feasable with extensive use of cleansing agents.
 
%c[0,204,0,51]4500 – 6000 mSv: %c[0,140,140,140]Intensification of the above symptoms. Additionally, permanent damage to central nervous system. Death highly probable.
 
%c[0,204,0,51]6000 mSv and above: %c[0,140,140,140]Imminent death. Often after rapid loss of consciousness.
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] unit: %c[0,210,210,210]mSv (milisivert)
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] imminent lethal radiation: %c[0,210,210,210]~6000+ mSv
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] av. outside rad. hot-spots potency: %c[0,210,210,210]~900 mSv / min
Buy underbarrel grenade launcher for rifle (D)

1. Thermal radiation
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Typical fire anomaly in the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone comprises two separate elements: %c[0,210,210,210]hemisphere-shaped thermal radiation field -%c[0,170,170,170] producing constant temperature of up to %c[0,210,210,210]50 kW / m2%c[0,170,170,170] density, inducing temperatures of up to %c[0,210,210,210]430 °C%c[0,170,170,170] and %c[0,210,210,210]'burner anomalies' -%c[0,170,170,170] destructive emissions of flames of up to %c[0,210,210,210]1000 °C%c[0,170,170,170] launching upwards from a single point usually located apporox. 10 cm above the ground. Mechanism governing these emissions hasn't been properly examined ,but we know for a fact that outbursts occur whenever any solid object enters an approximately%c[0,210,210,210]0,5 meters-wide%c[0,170,170,170] 'activation field' (of suspectedly gravitational nature).
 
%c[0,170,170,170]For the purposes of assessment of potency of Exclusion Zone's fire anomalies and in order to indicate available counter-measures a %c[0,210,210,210]kW/m2%c[0,170,170,170] (for kilowatts per square meter) (kilowatts per square meter equivalents) scale is used. This unit indicates a density of heat flux generated by the anomaly and thus the volume of energy.
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] inside of an average campfire: %c[0,210,210,210]500 °C or 29 kW/m2
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] average thermal rad. field flux: %c[0,210,210,210]620 °C or 51,5 kW/m2
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] average burner outburst: %c[0,210,210,210]1000 °C or 212 kW/m2
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] approx. unprotected surival time: %c[0,210,210,210]RF: 1,5 min / BU: 0,5 sec
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] approx. complete armor degr. time: %c[0,210,210,210]RF: 10 min / BU: 6 sec
 
%c[0,140,140,140]RF = radiation field ; BU = 'burner anomaly'
 
%c[0,210,210,210]2. Acid
 
%c[0,170,170,170]It is common knowledge that potent pools of acid (called 'fruit punch anomalies') can be found within Exclusion Zone's areas of high toxicity ('toxic anomalies'). These gravitationally sustained 'tanks' are extremely unstable and lose their form the moment they come in contact with solid matter. Any such occurrence produces a powerful outburst equivalent to the use of up to %c[0,210,210,210]0,5 liters%c[0,170,170,170] of potent oxidizing agents / sulphuric acid of %c[0,210,210,210]50%%c[0,170,170,170] concentration. These outbursts entail the eruption of acid which spreads in a form of droplets launching upwards in approximately %c[0,210,210,210]2 meter%c[0,170,170,170] radius.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Any substance of this level of corrosivity affects human body and equipment in a way similar to strong thermal radiation and causes the skin and other organic and non-organic substances to melt in a matter of seconds. It is thus highly advised to avoid these anomalies while unprotected by professional scientific equipment. In order to facilitate comparison the potency of acids is usually measured in thermal radiation scale of %c[0,210,210,210]kW / m2%c[0,170,170,170] equivalents.
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] Average 'Fruit punch' anomaly potency: %c[0,210,210,210]120 °C or 1,9 kW/m2 eq.

Toxicity
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Due to not yet fully grasped nature of substances found inside so called %c[0,210,210,210]'toxic anomalies'%c[0,170,170,170], danger assessment has to be performed in compliance with universal %c[0,210,210,210]LC50 (human)%c[0,170,170,170] standard.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]This standard measures overall toxicity of gaseous agents based on their level of concentration and indicates the dose which is required to kill %c[0,210,210,210]50%%c[0,170,170,170] of any random human 'test group' during exposure lasting %c[0,210,210,210]1 hour%c[0,170,170,170].
 
%c[0,170,170,170]As in most cases it only takes 10 parts per million parts(%c[0,210,210,210]ppm%c[0,170,170,170]) for Exclusion Zone's anomalous, bio-chemical agents to exceed %c[0,210,210,210]50% / 1 h%c[0,170,170,170] fatality rate, it is justified to include them in %c[0,210,210,210]Class I (C1) group%c[0,170,170,170] which comprises most potent toxic substances known to science. Exclusion Zone's anomalous toxic areas (which often cover several hundred square meters) have been proven to have the concentration of as much as 200 ppm (whereas '200' denotes the number of drops of such substances diluted in 1,000,000 parts of the solution), which makes them one of the most hazardous environments on the planet, strong enough to kill an average human being not protected with scientific equipment in about %c[0,210,210,210]3 minutes%c[0,170,170,170].
 
%c[0,170,170,170]For this reason and for assessment purposes potency of anomalous areas and effectiveness of protective gear is graded based on the amount of parts of (%c[0,210,210,210]ppm eq.%c[0,170,170,170]) concentration of %c[0,210,210,210]Class I (C1)%c[0,170,170,170] toxic substance per million parts of the solution (%c[0,210,210,210]ppm%c[0,170,170,170]). This gives an universal 'anomalous' toxicity measuring scale of %c[0,210,210,210]C1 ppm equivalents%c[0,170,170,170]. In the case of equipment this value indicates the C1 ppm toxicity concentration which certain item is able to protect from.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]From scientific data acquired so far we can deduce that in order to ensure a safe accomplishment of tasks that require venturing into one of Exclusion Zone's toxic anomalous areas, it is recommended to use equipment designed specifically for the purposes of anomaly exploration and 'artifact' gathering. However, even with appropriate gear it is still strongly advised to avoid prolonged exposure to anomalous toxic environments due to their proven highly corrosive properties.
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] av. toxic anomaly potency: %c[0,210,210,210]~200 C1 ppm eq.
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] av. unprot. survival time: %c[0,210,210,210]~3 min 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] av. time for compl. suit degr.: %c[0,210,210,210]~25 min
 
%c[0,204,0,51]IMPORTANT:
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Exclusion Zone's toxic fields are very often accompanied by large concentrations of acids (commonly known as 'fruit punch anomalies') which are capable of producing outbursts of highly potent oxidizing agents. Cf. 'Chapter 5: Flame / acid' of USS Field Manual for detailed risk assessment.

Armor protection level
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Armor protection level indicates %c[0,210,210,210]anti-ballistic%c[0,170,170,170] properties of a certain piece of body armor. For assessment purposes we use an internationally-recognized, American National Institute of Justice (NIJ) system of gradation of protective clothing based on a level of firearm projectile energy a certain piece is able to withstand.
 
%c[0,210,210,210]ARMOR GRADATION CHART:
 
%c[0,210,210,210]CLASS I:%c[0,170,170,170] 12x70 shot, grenade shrapnel
 
%c[0,210,210,210]CLASS IIA and II:%c[0,170,170,170] 9x18 mm, 9x18 mm +P+, 9x19 mm FMJ, 9x19 JHP, 45 ACP
 
%c[0,210,210,210]CLASS IIIA:%c[0,170,170,170] 357 HP, 45 Hydro, 5.56x45 mm FNJ
 
%c[0,210,210,210]CLASS III%c[0,170,170,170] 9x18 mm AP, 9x19 mm AP, 7.62x39 mm FMJ, 7.92x33 mm FMJ, 5.45x39 mm FNJ, 12x76 slug
 
%c[0,210,210,210]CLASS IV:%c[0,170,170,170] 9x39 mm SP-5, 7.62x51 mm NATO, .300 Win Mag, 45 AP, 7.92x33 mm AP
 
%c[0,210,210,210]CLASS V (exoskeleton):%c[0,170,170,170] 5.45x39 AP, 5.56x45 AP, 7.62x39 mm AP, 7.62x51 mm NATO AP, 7.62x54 PP, 9x39 mm SP-6, 7.62x54 mm 7H1
 
%c[0,204,0,51]IMPORTANT:
 
%c[0,170,170,170]The above-mentioned protection levels only relate to counter-penetration properties of armor. Bullet impact, even if it does not mange to pierce the armor, is still capable of inflicting damage by means of blunt trauma due to pure kinetic energy of the bullet. Most commonly only edema of soft tissues is the effect of the impact but in certain cases and if the force is strong enough it can lead to open bone fractures causing a bleeding wound which, if untreated, can result in death. Suits augmented with metal (especially titanium or steel) significantly reduce the probability of open bone fractures and overall negative effects of bullet impact.

External radiation sources
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Current readings indicate that radiation most commonly encountered in the Exclusion Zone travels by means of solid %c[0,210,210,210]alpha %c[0,170,170,170]particles which are present in dirt, sand, water and other objects and thus in all organisms living in the area for prolonged periods of time. Such radiation cannot penetrate the skin and is harmful only if charged particles make their way into the tissues and bloodstream - for example through inhaling air polluted with dust or eating contaminated food. For this reason it is strongly advised to wear filtered breathing apparatus in the Exclusion Zone at all times and avoid reliance on local food and water sources.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]As for penetrating %c[0,210,210,210]beta%c[0,170,170,170] radiation – our data confirm that it is still mostly concentrated around the CPP Unit 4 sarcophagus. However, it has been recently found that certain species within the Exclusion Zone emit penetrating ionizing radiation field at close range. For reasons unknown effects of this field cease as soon as the creature dies.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]The final and the most dangerous source of ionizing radiation within the Exclusion Zone are surge emissions, during which gamma blasts of various potency have been detected. Due to the amount of pure energy released and penetrating power of gamma radiation it is highly recommended to take cover in safe locations whenever the emission takes place.
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140]cloth mask protection rate: %c[0,210,210,210]45%
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140]breathing filters protection rate: %c[0,210,210,210]90%
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140]envirnomental suit protection rate.: %c[0,210,210,210]100%

Electricity
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Electrical anomalies of the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone are undoubtedly one of its potentially most beneficial creations. Powerful and constant electric arcs stretched in what appears to be a simple composition of gases could if harnessed provide enormous amounts of pure energy. Unfortunately, all attempts to obtain electricity from these anomalies were to no avail since they are extremely unstable and any contact with solid matter results in massive outbursts of energy. Such phenomena are unheard of in modern science as our sensors have registered a sudden rise in both voltage and current that would cause any capacitors currently produced to overheat due to the erratic nature of the anomaly.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Voltage peaks produced during such outbursts amount to %c[0,210,210,210]4,0 megavolts (MV)%c[0,170,170,170], which allows the current to reach as high as %c[0,210,210,210]3,5 meters%c[0,170,170,170] above the ground. Since the outbursts last around %c[0,210,210,210]50 miliseconds%c[0,170,170,170]energy produced inside the anomaly during one outburst is not enough to kill a healthy, grown man. However, extensive health damage and severe trauma should be expected and the second outburst (which is very likely to occur if one does not exit the field without undue delay) is in most cases fatal.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]As is the case with all static electrical discharges the best means of protection is increasing electrical resistance of the body. This can be achieved in several ways, primarily by wearing protective, non-conductive clothing. There are also military and civilian grade surge suppressors available on the market. Moreover, out most recent data suggests that there are certain 'artifacts' rarely found in the Exclusion Zone possessing the qualities of very potent electrical resistors.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]For the purposes of USS operations in the Exclusion Zone effectiveness of all means of electrical resistance and combat armors is measured in the number of kilovolts (%c[0,210,210,210]kV%c[0,170,170,170]) a given piece of equipment is able to resist during a single%c[0,210,210,210]3000 kV%c[0,170,170,170] / %c[0,210,210,210]50 ms%c[0,170,170,170] outburst of electrical anomaly.
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] av. electrical anomaly power: %c[0,210,210,210]~3 MV
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] single outburst dam. rate to unprot. body: %c[0,210,210,210] 95%

Psy influence
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Scientific data regarding the origin and nature of so called 'psy fields' found quite commonly inside the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone is %c[0,204,0,51]classified%c[0,170,170,170] and not relevant to this mission.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]It is, however, essential for any USS operative to be aware of the fact that these forces pose extreme danger to any human being and should be avoided at all cost. Such fields ordinarily take a hemispherical shape with the source at their centre. Of note is that they are able to either immediately kill or induce an unrecoverable coma within seconds of exposure (this applies to any human being not protected with additional equipment). The potency of psy field varies depending on the distance from the source: the weakest being at the edges of the field and increasing at geometric rate the closer to the source.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]It has been established that beside the main 'psy radiation', each field also produces a faint, low frequency (%c[0,210,210,210]50-60 Hz%c[0,170,170,170]) magnetic field which althou harmless, can be easly detected and measured allowing for assesment of main psy field's strenght. For this reason potency of psy fields (and effectivity of counter-measures) is given in militeslas (%c[0,210,210,210]mT%c[0,170,170,170]) which indicate intensity of accompanying magnetic field.
 
%c[0,210,210,210]KNOWN SOURCES:
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] surge emssion: %c[0,210,210,210]35 mT (constant flux) ; 660 mT (blowout wave) 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] average psy anomaly: %c[0,210,210,210]E 3mT ; C 45 mT
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] controller mutant: %c[0,210,210,210]E 5 mT ; C 75 mT ; R 33 m
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] poltergeist mutant: %c[0,210,210,210]E 8 mT ; C 90 mT ; R 52 m
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] burer mutant: %c[0,210,210,210]E 2 mT ; C 50 mT ; R 26 m
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] psy-dog mutant: %c[0,210,210,210]E 0.1 mT ; C 15 mT ; R 23 m
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] Yantar complex (inactive): %c[0,210,210,210]E 0.001 mT ; C 1800 mT (est.) ; R ~3,5 km
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] 'Brain scorcher' (inactive): %c[0,210,210,210]E 0.001 mT ; C 6500 mT (est.) ; R ~20 km
 
%c[0,140,140,140]E = edge of the field
%c[0,140,140,140]C = epicenter of the field
%c[0,140,140,140]R = range

Rupture protection
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Rupture protection level remains a significant factor when operating within the Chernobyl Exclusion Zone and must not be underestimated. This is due to often extremely aggressive and carnivorous fauna which has mutated excessively owing to the special characteristics of the Exclusion Zone and developed lethal means of incapacitating the target.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]The collective term %c[0,210,210,210]'mutants'%c[0,170,170,170] refers to beings of animal and possibly human origin which are the outcome of this abnormal evolution. They can take a variety of shapes and forms depending on their progenitor and the extent of mutation – and have at their disposal several means of inflicting damage and killing their prey. Common types of attacks include biting, cutting the skin and clothing with sharp claws, stabbing with protruding fangs, charging at the prey as well as kicks and punches.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]The most popular means of protection against this threat is using clothing manufactured in such a way so as to make in virtually impenetrable to animal attacks. Although normally even a thin layer of protective material can keep you out of harm's way, in the Exclusion Zone it is advisable to use only specially designed anti-laceration fibers. For convenience reasons such fibers are integrated into almost every modern type of anti-ballistic personal armor.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Rupture protection values of a certain armor piece are in direct connection to its anti-ballistic protection class. This is especially true of any NIJ %c[0,210,210,210]Class AIII (and higher)%c[0,170,170,170] and above which have increasingly large number of integrated %c[0,210,210,210]metal plates%c[0,170,170,170]The use of metal plates is by far the most effective method of protecting oneself from rupture damage.
 
%c[0,204,0,51]IMPORTANT:
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Even though clothing of high durability and thickness can significantly reduce damage inflicted by firearm projectiles and animal attacks of all kinds, the materials the clothing is made of are not indestructible and will slowly degrade, gradually decreasing its environmental and physical protection values. Rate at which armor degrades is %c[0,210,210,210]is not a constant value%c[0,170,170,170] and depends on the condition of the unit, which means that %c[0,204,0,51]the condition of equipment will deteriorate the faster the more damaged the equipment.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]For this reason it is %c[0,210,210,210]strongly advised%c[0,170,170,170] to undertake maintenance of suits and headgears as frequently as possible and avoid taking severe, structural damage.

Stamina recovery
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Stamina level represents available energy used sustain ability for physical extertion. Severe loss of stamina neglects the ability to move, but it can be recovered in relatively shot time thru resting during which muscles are relaxed and energy is not futher drained. Rate at which stamina is lost and regained depends on numerous factors, which which can generally be divided to: 'nutrition', 'equipment', 'chemical' and 'artifact-based' categories. For operative's convenience a following list of most important nutrition restoration facts has been created.
 
%c[0,210,210,210]Basic facts list:
 
%c[0,210,210,210]1.%c[0,170,170,170] natural means only allow to fill the bar in approx. 33%
 
%c[0,210,210,210]2.%c[0,170,170,170] To keep the bar at 'nominal' 33% consumption of energy (kcal) is required. Energy is available in food and drinks.
 
%c[0,210,210,210]3.%c[0,170,170,170] nominal 33% level can be lowered if worn armor suit is restraining to agents movement.
 
%c[0,210,210,210]3.%c[0,170,170,170]Stamina recovery is also lineary affected by carried weight but this factor is not represented on the bar.
 
%c[0,210,210,210]4.%c[0,170,170,170] To rise the bar above nominal level one has to use chemical or artifact based boosting effect.
 
%c[0,210,210,210]5.%c[0,170,170,170]Potency of chemical boosters is given in µg (micrograms) of adrenaline they 'produce' in the body.
 
%c[0,210,210,210]6.%c[0,170,170,170]Potency of chemical boosters is given in µg (micrograms) of adrenaline they 'produce' in the body.
 
%c[0,210,210,210]7.%c[0,170,170,170]Nominal adrenaline ammount present in the body is 90 µg. To double this ammount one has to cosume 400 mg of caffeine.
 
%c[0,210,210,210]8.%c[0,170,170,170] To double speed up the stamina recovery two times (rise the bar to 66%) one has to rapidly increase the nominal adrenaline ammount by five times (induce releasing of 500 µg of adrenaline into the bloodstream).
 
%c[0,210,210,210]9.%c[0,170,170,170] The effectivity of various substances is not stackable. Consuming less-powerfull substance after stronger one will result in weakening of boosting effect.
 
%c[0,210,210,210]8.%c[0,170,170,170]To rise the bar beyond 66% artifact radiation is required. Artifact radiation will work stronger the higher recovery rate attained by other means prior to artifact usage.
Online S.T.A.L.K.E.R. services are not accessible.

Bleeding
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Bleeding can drain vital power at a very fast rate if not treated promptly. Bleeding wounds are most often the result of external, physical force of any type penetrating the body armor and rupturing the skin sometimes along with internal organs. Bleeding can also be the effect of open bone fractures caused by blunt trauma.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Average USS operator can withstand a blood loss of up to approximately %c[0,210,210,210]2,7 liter %c[0,170,170,170]without losing consciousness. Extremely serious (or a large number of smaller) wounds can cause blood loss of this magnitude in %c[0,210,210,210]10 to 5 minutes%c[0,170,170,170]. Bandages or field wound sewing kits can effectively stop the bleeding, while drugs increasing blood density or coagulating agents can be used to reduce the overall rate of bleeding.
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] body blood volume: %c[0,170,170,170]~5,5 liters
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] mortal blood loss: %c[0,170,170,170]~2,7 liters
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] 5.45 mun. shoot to unprot. torso: %c[0,170,170,170]~320 ml / min
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] reg. bandage eff.: %c[0,170,170,170]~270 ml / min 
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Rates Chart:
 
%c[0,102,255,0]0 - 50 ml / min: %c[0,140,140,140] mild
%c[0,255,255,0]50 - 150 ml / min: %c[0,140,140,140]significant
%c[0,255,122,0]150 - 300 ml / min: %c[0,140,140,140] severe
%c[0,204,0,51]300+ ml / min: %c[0,140,140,140]critical

Health
 
%c[0,170,170,170]What is known as overall health could be better described as the %c[0,210,210,210]ability and will %c[0,170,170,170]to take care of yourself and keep moving. The Zone is an unforgiving place. Someone offering a helping hand almost never happens. Chances are, if you are incapacitated, then the mutants, the weather, emissions or something stranger, will finish you off. Those with insufficient will, succumb to lesser pain, and those that are resilient and rough, can withstand more beatings by the Zone.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]A superficial gunshot wound doesn't disable movement altogether, but it certainly causes %c[0,210,210,210]pain%c[0,170,170,170], and when the torture of different pain inducing, or %c[0,210,210,210]unpleasant feelings %c[0,170,170,170]accumulate, the body refuses to follow commands by the brain, and shock, loss of consciousness, physical movement impairment sets in.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]The Zone does not respect those who help others. Because of that, you will see a lot of Stalkers that leave friends behind. A seasoned Stalker would know that if push comes to shove, he'd have to leave his best friend behind without a second thought. Newbies and (very rarely) Zone men, fall to the trappings of morality and attempt rescue of downed fellow men. Those that do attempt rescue, either learn their lessons and never attempt rescue again, or simply vanish themselves to similar circumstances.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]What armor nor shields could ever protect, is the human will, which mostly feeds from within. You could further you ability to withstand the pressure of the Zone on your willpower, by %c[0,210,210,210]consuming pleasurable substances%c[0,170,170,170], food, engage in activities that keep the spirit alive. A slight increase in health is then apparent. Practicing reflexes, strategy, and having solid understanding of yourself under stressful situations, certainly influences the ability of the willpower to continue pushing despite opposite pressure.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Psychologically traumatic influences erode the will and drain health very quickly, especially those with immense potency like emissions or anomalies.
 
%c[0,170,170,170]When health is completely drained, practically, the subject is removed from the Zone, only his fellow men would continue, those that still remain willing.
Allows you to survive an emission
